AllowMultipleAutomaticDownloadsInQuickSu.description: Allow multiple automatic downloads in quick succession on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow multiple automatic downloads in quick succession on specific sites

AllowMultipleAutomaticDownloadsInQuickSu.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 110, Windows 7 or later
AllowMultipleAutomaticDownloadsInQuickSu.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to perform multiple successive automatic downloads.
If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultAutomaticDownloadsSetting' (Default automatic downloads setting) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, then the user's personal setting applies.
For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

AllowSessionOnlyCookiesOnSpecificSites.description: Allow session-only cookies on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow session-only cookies on specific sites

AllowSessionOnlyCookiesOnSpecificSites.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
AllowSessionOnlyCookiesOnSpecificSites.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to set session-only cookies.
If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultCookiesSetting' (Default cookies setting) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, then the user's personal setting applies.
For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

AllowWebHidAccessToAllDevicesOnSpecificS.description: Allow Web HID access to all devices on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow Web HID access to all devices on specific sites

AllowWebHidAccessToAllDevicesOnSpecificS.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
AllowWebHidAccessToAllDevicesOnSpecificS.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to access all HID devices.

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

AllowWebHidAccessToSpecificDevicesOnSpec.description: Allow Web HID access to specific devices on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow Web HID access to specific devices on specific sites

AllowWebHidAccessToSpecificDevicesOnSpec.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
AllowWebHidAccessToSpecificDevicesOnSpec.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites and devices, based on URL patterns and device IDs, that are allowed to access HID devices.

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com:0x1234
[*.]contoso.edu:0x5678

AllowWebUsbAccessToSpecificDevicesOnSpec.description: Allow Web USB access to specific devices on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow Web USB access to specific devices on specific sites

AllowWebUsbAccessToSpecificDevicesOnSpec.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
AllowWebUsbAccessToSpecificDevicesOnSpec.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites and devices, based on URL patterns and device IDs, that are allowed to access USB devices.

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com:0x1234
[*.]contoso.edu:0x5678

AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.description: Automatically select client certificates for these sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Automatically select client certificates for these sites

AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.description-detailed:
Setting the policy lets you make a list of URL patterns that specify sites for which Microsoft Edge can automatically select a client certificate. The value is an array of stringified JSON dictionaries, each with the form { "pattern": "$URL_PATTERN", "filter" : $FILTER }, where $URL_PATTERN is a content setting pattern. $FILTER restricts the client certificates the browser automatically selects from. Independent of the filter, only certificates that match the server's certificate request are selected.

Examples for the usage of the $FILTER section:

* When $FILTER is set to { "ISSUER": { "CN": "$ISSUER_CN" } }, only client certificates issued by a certificate with the CommonName $ISSUER_CN are selected.

* When $FILTER contains both the "ISSUER" and the "SUBJECT" sections, only client certificates that satisfy both conditions are selected.

* When $FILTER contains a "SUBJECT" section with the "O" value, a certificate needs at least one organization matching the specified value to be selected.

* When $FILTER contains a "SUBJECT" section with a "OU" value, a certificate needs at least one organizational unit matching the specified value to be selected.

* When $FILTER is set to {}, the selection of client certificates is not additionally restricted. Note that filters provided by the web server still apply.

If you leave the policy unset, there's no autoselection for any site.

Example value:

{"pattern":"https://www.contoso.com","filter":{"ISSUER":{"CN":"certificate issuer name", "L": "certificate issuer location", "O": "certificate issuer org", "OU": "certificate issuer org unit"}, "SUBJECT":{"CN":"certificate subject name", "L": "certificate subject location", "O": "certificate subject org", "OU": "certificate subject org unit"}}}

AutomaticDownloadsAllowedForUrls.description: Allow multiple automatic downloads in quick succession on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow multiple automatic downloads in quick succession on specific sites

AutomaticFullscreenBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow cookies on specific sites

CookiesAllowedForUrls.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
CookiesAllowedForUrls.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to set cookies.
If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultCookiesSetting' (Default cookies setting) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, then the user's personal setting applies.
For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

[*.]contoso.edu

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block cookies on specific sites

CookiesBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are blocked from setting cookies. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultCookiesSetting' (Configure default cookies setting) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

DataUrlInSvgUseEnabled.description: Allow data: URL in SVG use

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow data: URL in SVG use

DataUrlInSvgUseEnabled.description-detailed:
This policy controls whether data: URLs are allowed in SVG <use> elements.

If you enable this policy, data: URLs are allowed in SVG <use> elements. This may introduce a security risk.

If you disable this policy, data: URLs are not allowed in SVG <use> elements. This is the more secure option.

If you don't configure this policy, the user can configure this setting.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for automatic downloads

DefaultAutomaticDownloadsSetting.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 110, Windows 7 or later
DefaultAutomaticDownloadsSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for automatic downloads. Automatic downloads are downloads that start without any user interaction.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 1 = Allow all sites to perform automatic downloads.
* 2 = Block all sites from performing automatic downloads.

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls automatic downloads.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for cookies

DefaultCookiesSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for cookies.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to set cookies (not recommended).
* 1 = Allow first-party cookies and block third-party cookies.
* 2 = Block all sites from setting cookies (not recommended).
* 4 = Allow cookies for the duration of the session.

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls cookies.

DefaultFileSystemReadGuardSetting.description: Default File System Read Guard setting

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for File System Read Guard

DefaultFileSystemReadGuardSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for File System Read Guard, which protects users from malicious websites reading files from the local file system.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to read files from the local file system (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to read files from the local file system.
* 2 = Block all sites from reading files from the local file system (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls File System Read Guard.

DefaultFileSystemWriteGuardSetting.description: Default File System Write Guard setting

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for File System Write Guard

DefaultFileSystemWriteGuardSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for File System Write Guard, which protects users from malicious websites writing files to the local file system.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to write files to the local file system (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to write files to the local file system.
* 2 = Block all sites from writing files to the local file system (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls File System Write Guard.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for geolocation

DefaultGeolocationSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for geolocation.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to track the user’s physical location (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to track their physical location.
* 2 = Block all sites from tracking the user’s physical location (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls geolocation.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for images

DefaultImagesSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for images.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 1 = Allow all sites to show images.
* 2 = Block all sites from showing images.

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls images.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for insecure content

DefaultInsecureContentSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for insecure content (HTTP content on HTTPS sites).

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to show insecure content (not recommended).
* 1 = Block all sites from showing insecure content (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls insecure content.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for JavaScript JIT

DefaultJavaScriptJitSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for JavaScript JIT (Just-In-Time compilation).

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to use JavaScript JIT.
* 1 = Block all sites from using JavaScript JIT.

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls JavaScript JIT.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for JavaScript

DefaultJavaScriptSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for JavaScript.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 1 = Allow all sites to run JavaScript (not recommended).
* 2 = Block all sites from running JavaScript (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls JavaScript.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for notifications

DefaultNotificationsSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for notifications.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to show notifications (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to show notifications.
* 2 = Block all sites from showing notifications (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls notifications.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for plugins

DefaultPluginsSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for plugins.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 1 = Allow all sites to use plugins (not recommended).
* 2 = Block all sites from using plugins (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls plugins.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for popups

DefaultPopupsSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for popups.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 1 = Allow all sites to show popups (not recommended).
* 2 = Block all sites from showing popups (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls popups.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for Third-Party Storage Partitioning

DefaultThirdPartyStoragePartitioningSett.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for Third-Party Storage Partitioning, which isolates third-party storage to prevent cross-site tracking.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow third-party storage partitioning for all sites (not recommended).
* 1 = Block third-party storage partitioning for all sites (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls Third-Party Storage Partitioning.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for Web Bluetooth Guard

DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for Web Bluetooth Guard, which protects users from malicious websites accessing Bluetooth devices.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to access Bluetooth devices (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to access Bluetooth devices.
* 2 = Block all sites from accessing Bluetooth devices (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls Web Bluetooth Guard.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for Web HID Guard

DefaultWebHidGuardSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for Web HID Guard, which protects users from malicious websites accessing HID devices.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to access HID devices (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to access HID devices.
* 2 = Block all sites from accessing HID devices (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls Web HID Guard.

FileSystemReadAskForUrls.description: Allow read access via the File System API on these sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow read access via the File System API on these sites

FileSystemReadAskForUrls.description-detailed: This policy specifies sites that can ask users for read access to the host operating system's filesystem via the File System API. The value is a JSON array of URL patterns.

FileSystemReadAskForUrls.description: Allow read access via the File System API on these sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow read access via the File System API on these sites

FileSystemReadAskForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are allowed to ask the user for read access via the File System API. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultFileSystemReadGuardSetting' (Configure default setting for File System Read Guard) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

FileSystemReadBlockedForUrls.description: Block read access via the File System API on these sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block read access via the File System API on these sites

FileSystemReadBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are blocked from read access via the File System API. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultFileSystemReadGuardSetting' (Configure default setting for File System Read Guard) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

FileSystemWriteAskForUrls.description: Allow write access via the File System API on these sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow write access via the File System API on these sites

FileSystemWriteAskForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are allowed to ask the user for write access via the File System API. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultFileSystemWriteGuardSetting' (Configure default setting for File System Write Guard) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

FileSystemWriteBlockedForUrls.description: Block write access via the File System API on these sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block write access via the File System API on these sites

FileSystemWriteBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are blocked from write access via the File System API. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultFileSystemWriteGuardSetting' (Configure default setting for File System Write Guard) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

Example value:

ImagesAllowedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are allowed to show images. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultImagesSetting' (Configure default setting for images) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

[*.]contoso.edu

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block images on specific sites

ImagesBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are blocked from showing images. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultImagesSetting' (Configure default setting for images) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.description: Allow insecure content on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow insecure content on specific sites

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are allowed to show insecure content (HTTP content on HTTPS sites). URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultInsecureContentSetting' (Configure default setting for insecure content) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

[*.]contoso.edu

InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.description: Block insecure content on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block insecure content on specific sites

InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are blocked from showing insecure content (HTTP content on HTTPS sites). URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultInsecureContentSetting' (Configure default setting for insecure content) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

IntranetFileLinksEnabled.description: Enable opening intranet files from internet

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Enable opening intranet files from internet

IntranetFileLinksEnabled.description-detailed:
This policy controls whether users can open local intranet files from the internet.

If you enable this policy, users can open local intranet files from the internet. This may introduce a security risk.

If you disable this policy, users can’t open local intranet files from the internet. This is the more secure option.

If you don't configure this policy, the user can configure this setting.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow JavaScript on specific sites

JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are allowed to run JavaScript. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultJavaScriptSetting' (Configure default setting for JavaScript) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.description: Allow insecure content on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow insecure content on specific sites

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to load insecure content.

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

[*.]contoso.edu

InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.description: Block insecure content on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow JavaScript JIT compilation on specific sites

JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
JavaScriptJitAllowedForSites.description-detailed:

JavaScriptOptimizerAllowedForSites.description: Allow JavaScript optimizer on specific sites

JavaScriptOptimizerAllowedForSites.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
JavaScriptOptimizerAllowedForSites.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are allowed to use the JavaScript optimizer.

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

[*.]contoso.edu

JavaScriptOptimizerBlockedForSites.description: Block JavaScript optimizer on specific sites

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block JavaScript optimizer on specific sites

JavaScriptOptimizerBlockedForSites.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
JavaScriptOptimizerBlockedForSites.description-detailed:

[*.]contoso.edu

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Enable legacy SameSite cookie behavior

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.description-detailed:
This policy controls whether to enable legacy SameSite cookie behavior.

If you leave this policy unset, the default behavior is disabled.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.description: Enable legacy SameSite cookie behavior for specific domains

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Enable legacy SameSite cookie behavior for specific domains

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.description-detailed:
Define a list of domains that should use legacy SameSite cookie behavior.

For more detailed information about valid domain patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Partitioned blob URL usage setting

PartitionedBlobUrlUsage.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
PartitionedBlobUrlUsage.description-detailed:
This policy controls the usage of partitioned blob URLs.

0: Disable
1: Enable

If you leave this policy unset, the user's personal setting applies.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Registered protocol handlers

RegisteredProtocolHandlers.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
RegisteredProtocolHandlers.description-detailed:
Define a list of protocol handlers that are registered with the browser.

For more detailed information about valid protocol handler formats, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

mailto:https://mail.contoso.com/?to=%s
webcal:https://calendar.contoso.com/?event=%s

SerialAllowAllPortsForUrls.description-detailed:

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Show PDF default recommendations

ShowPDFDefaultRecommendationsEnabled.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
ShowPDFDefaultRecommendationsEnabled.description-detailed:
This policy controls whether to show PDF default recommendations.

If you leave this policy unset, the default behavior is enabled.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Enable Spotlight experiences and recommendations

SpotlightExperiencesAndRecommendationsEn.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
SpotlightExperiencesAndRecommendationsEn.description-detailed:
This policy controls whether to enable Spotlight experiences and recommendations.

If you leave this policy unset, the default behavior is enabled.

ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.description: Block third-party storage partitioning for specific origins

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block third-party storage partitioning for specific origins

ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
ThirdPartyStoragePartitioningBlockedForO.description-detailed:

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow Web HID access to devices with specific HID usages on specific sites

WebHidAllowDevicesWithHidUsagesForUrls.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 77, Windows 7 or later
WebHidAllowDevicesWithHidUsagesForUrls.description-detailed:
Define a list of sites and HID usages, based on URL patterns and usage IDs, that are allowed to access HID devices.

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

For more detailed information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.description-detailed: This policy specifies which sites can connect to specific USB devices. The value is a JSON array of objects, each containing a URL pattern and a list of USB device IDs.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Configure default setting for Web USB Guard

DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.description-detailed:
This policy controls the default setting for Web USB Guard, which protects users from malicious websites accessing USB devices.

If you enable this policy, you can select one of the following options:

* 0 = Allow all sites to access USB devices (not recommended).
* 1 = Ask the user whether to allow a site to access USB devices.
* 2 = Block all sites from accessing USB devices (recommended).

If you disable or don’t configure this policy, the user’s setting controls Web USB Guard.

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Allow notifications on specific sites

NotificationsAllowedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are allowed to show notifications. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultNotificationsSetting' (Configure default setting for notifications) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
[*.]contoso.edu

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Content settings\Block notifications on specific sites

NotificationsBlockedForUrls.description-detailed:
Specify a list of URL patterns that specify sites that are blocked from showing notifications. URL patterns are case-sensitive.

If you don't configure this policy, 'DefaultNotificationsSetting' (Configure default setting for notifications) applies for all sites, if it's set. If it isn't set, the user can configure this setting.

For more information about valid URL patterns, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

Example value:

https://contoso.com
